Problem:
Consider a set of eigenfunctions \\( v_n \\) associated with an operator \\( L \\) and a function \\( f(x) \\) that can be expressed as a linear combination of these eigenfunctions. The impact of applying Fourier series transformation and its inverse is analyzed over function \\( f(x) \\).

If the Fourier series transformation is applied to \\( f(x) \\), then the function evolves naturally (i.e., under its inherent properties without external modifications) during the application, will \\( f(x) \\) still represent the same initial physical phenomena?
Explanation: The Fourier series transformation decomposes the function into a sum of sinusoids or exponential functions which are eigenfunctions if the domain and boundary conditions align with the operator (L). Since this transformation is reversible and preserves the information of the original function, the integrity and representation of the initial physical phenomena are maintained.
